title: Conversation: Bullets & Steel—The Making of Elizabethan Armor
hero_caption: Jeffrey D. Wasson. Photo courtesy of the artist.
short_description:
Hear from Jeffrey D. Wasson, the armorer who crafted the historically accurate replica of the Art Institute's Greenwich armor. This project, led by Wasson and curator Jonathan Tavares, used experimental archaeology to uncover how armorers could craft bulletproof protection and appeared in Secrets of the Shining Knight on PBS’s NOVA series.

Wasson's lecture was originally planned for January 31, 2019, but was rescheduled from its original date last January 31, 2019. If this program reaches capacity, a stand-by line will form outside the venue at 5:30 p.m. for seats that become available.
description:
Hear from Jeffrey D. Wasson, the armorer who crafted the accurate replica of the Art Institute's Greenwich armor. This project, led by Wasson and Art Institute curator Jonathan Tavares, used experimental archaeology to uncover how armorers crafted bulletproof protection. It appeared in Secrets of the Shining Knight on PBS’s NOVA series.

Wasson's lecture was originally scheduled for January 31, 2019, and was moved to November 21, 2019.

﻿If this program reaches capacity, a stand-by line will form outside the venue at 5:30 p.m. for seats that become available.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
